children.name: according
children.sourceText: Because I do not teach the foolish traditions of your fathers, and because I do not teach this people to bind themselves down under the foolish ordinances and performances which are laid down by ancient priests, to usurp power and authority over them, to keep them in ignorance, that they may not lift up their heads, but be brought down according to thy words.

children.name: insomuch
children.sourceText: And I have taught his words; and I taught them because they were pleasing unto the carnal mind; and I taught them, even until I had much success, insomuch that I verily believed that they were true; and for this cause I withstood the truth, even until I have brought this great curse upon me.

children.name: a
children.sourceText: O ye that are bound down under a foolish and a vain hope, why do ye yoke yourselves with such foolish things?

children.name: after
children.sourceText: And ye say also that he shall be slain for the sins of the world, And thus ye lead away this people after the foolish traditions of your fathers, and according to your own desires; and ye keep them down, even as it were in bondage, that ye may glut yourselves with the labors of their hands, that they durst not look up with boldness, and that they durst not enjoy their rights and privileges.

children.name: an
children.sourceText: But behold, the devil hath deceived me; for he appeared unto me in the form of an angel, and said unto me:

children.name: and
children.sourceText: O ye that are bound down under a foolish and a vain hope, why do ye yoke yourselves with such foolish things?

children.name: anything
children.sourceText: For no man can know of anything which is to come.

children.name: as
children.sourceText: And ye say also that he shall be slain for the sins of the world, And thus ye lead away this people after the foolish traditions of your fathers, and according to your own desires; and ye keep them down, even as it were in bondage, that ye may glut yourselves with the labors of their hands, that they durst not look up with boldness, and that they durst not enjoy their rights and privileges.

children.name: because
children.sourceText: But behold, it is the effect of a frenzied mind; and this derangement of your minds comes because of the traditions of your fathers, which lead you away into a belief of things which are not so.

children.name: but
children.sourceText: But behold, it is the effect of a frenzied mind; and this derangement of your minds comes because of the traditions of your fathers, which lead you away into a belief of things which are not so.

children.name: by
children.sourceText: Behold, these things which ye call prophecies, which ye say are handed down by holy prophets, behold, they are foolish traditions of your fathers.

children.name: can
children.sourceText: For no man can know of anything which is to come.

children.name: could
children.sourceText: I know that I am dumb, for I cannot speak; and I know that nothing save it were the power of God could bring this upon me; yea, and I always knew that there was a God.

children.name: down
children.sourceText: O ye that are bound down under a foolish and a vain hope, why do ye yoke yourselves with such foolish things?

children.name: except
children.sourceText: Yea, I will deny, except ye shall show me a sign.

children.name: for
children.sourceText: Why do ye look for a Christ?

children.name: he
children.sourceText: And ye say also that he shall be slain for the sins of the world, And thus ye lead away this people after the foolish traditions of your fathers, and according to your own desires; and ye keep them down, even as it were in bondage, that ye may glut yourselves with the labors of their hands, that they durst not look up with boldness, and that they durst not enjoy their rights and privileges.

children.name: his
children.sourceText: And I have taught his words; and I taught them because they were pleasing unto the carnal mind; and I taught them, even until I had much success, insomuch that I verily believed that they were true; and for this cause I withstood the truth, even until I have brought this great curse upon me.

children.name: I
children.sourceText: Because I do not teach the foolish traditions of your fathers, and because I do not teach this people to bind themselves down under the foolish ordinances and performances which are laid down by ancient priests, to usurp power and authority over them, to keep them in ignorance, that they may not lift up their heads, but be brought down according to thy words.

children.name: if
children.sourceText: Yea, they durst not make use of that which is their own lest they should offend their priests, who do yoke them according to their desires, and have brought them to believe, by their traditions and their dreams and their whims and their visions and their pretended mysteries, that they should, if they did not do according to their words, offend some unknown being, who they say is God, a being who never has been seen or known, who never was nor ever will be.

children.name: in
children.sourceText: Because I do not teach the foolish traditions of your fathers, and because I do not teach this people to bind themselves down under the foolish ordinances and performances which are laid down by ancient priests, to usurp power and authority over them, to keep them in ignorance, that they may not lift up their heads, but be brought down according to thy words.

children.name: into
children.sourceText: But behold, it is the effect of a frenzied mind; and this derangement of your minds comes because of the traditions of your fathers, which lead you away into a belief of things which are not so.

children.name: it
children.sourceText: But behold, it is the effect of a frenzied mind; and this derangement of your minds comes because of the traditions of your fathers, which lead you away into a belief of things which are not so.

children.name: its
children.sourceText: Behold, I say that a child is not guilty because of its parents.

children.name: lest
children.sourceText: Yea, they durst not make use of that which is their own lest they should offend their priests, who do yoke them according to their desires, and have brought them to believe, by their traditions and their dreams and their whims and their visions and their pretended mysteries, that they should, if they did not do according to their words, offend some unknown being, who they say is God, a being who never has been seen or known, who never was nor ever will be.

children.name: may
children.sourceText: Because I do not teach the foolish traditions of your fathers, and because I do not teach this people to bind themselves down under the foolish ordinances and performances which are laid down by ancient priests, to usurp power and authority over them, to keep them in ignorance, that they may not lift up their heads, but be brought down according to thy words.

children.name: me
children.sourceText: If thou wilt show me a sign, that I may be convinced that there is a God, yea, show unto me that he hath power, and then will I be convinced of the truth of thy words.

children.name: nor
children.sourceText: Yea, they durst not make use of that which is their own lest they should offend their priests, who do yoke them according to their desires, and have brought them to believe, by their traditions and their dreams and their whims and their visions and their pretended mysteries, that they should, if they did not do according to their words, offend some unknown being, who they say is God, a being who never has been seen or known, who never was nor ever will be.

children.name: nothing
children.sourceText: I know that I am dumb, for I cannot speak; and I know that nothing save it were the power of God could bring this upon me; yea, and I always knew that there was a God.

children.name: o
children.sourceText: O ye that are bound down under a foolish and a vain hope, why do ye yoke yourselves with such foolish things?

children.name: of
children.sourceText: For no man can know of anything which is to come.

children.name: or
children.sourceText: Yea, they durst not make use of that which is their own lest they should offend their priests, who do yoke them according to their desires, and have brought them to believe, by their traditions and their dreams and their whims and their visions and their pretended mysteries, that they should, if they did not do according to their words, offend some unknown being, who they say is God, a being who never has been seen or known, who never was nor ever will be.

children.name: over
children.sourceText: Because I do not teach the foolish traditions of your fathers, and because I do not teach this people to bind themselves down under the foolish ordinances and performances which are laid down by ancient priests, to usurp power and authority over them, to keep them in ignorance, that they may not lift up their heads, but be brought down according to thy words.

children.name: save
children.sourceText: I know that I am dumb, for I cannot speak; and I know that nothing save it were the power of God could bring this upon me; yea, and I always knew that there was a God.

children.name: shall
children.sourceText: Behold, ye cannot know of things which ye do not see; therefore ye cannot know that there shall be a Christ.

children.name: should
children.sourceText: Yea, they durst not make use of that which is their own lest they should offend their priests, who do yoke them according to their desires, and have brought them to believe, by their traditions and their dreams and their whims and their visions and their pretended mysteries, that they should, if they did not do according to their words, offend some unknown being, who they say is God, a being who never has been seen or known, who never was nor ever will be.

children.name: so
children.sourceText: But behold, it is the effect of a frenzied mind; and this derangement of your minds comes because of the traditions of your fathers, which lead you away into a belief of things which are not so.

children.name: some
children.sourceText: Yea, they durst not make use of that which is their own lest they should offend their priests, who do yoke them according to their desires, and have brought them to believe, by their traditions and their dreams and their whims and their visions and their pretended mysteries, that they should, if they did not do according to their words, offend some unknown being, who they say is God, a being who never has been seen or known, who never was nor ever will be.

children.name: such
children.sourceText: O ye that are bound down under a foolish and a vain hope, why do ye yoke yourselves with such foolish things?

children.name: that
children.sourceText: O ye that are bound down under a foolish and a vain hope, why do ye yoke yourselves with such foolish things?

children.name: the
children.sourceText: But behold, it is the effect of a frenzied mind; and this derangement of your minds comes because of the traditions of your fathers, which lead you away into a belief of things which are not so.

children.name: their
children.sourceText: How do ye know of their surety?

children.name: them
children.sourceText: Because I do not teach the foolish traditions of your fathers, and because I do not teach this people to bind themselves down under the foolish ordinances and performances which are laid down by ancient priests, to usurp power and authority over them, to keep them in ignorance, that they may not lift up their heads, but be brought down according to thy words.

children.name: themselves
children.sourceText: Because I do not teach the foolish traditions of your fathers, and because I do not teach this people to bind themselves down under the foolish ordinances and performances which are laid down by ancient priests, to usurp power and authority over them, to keep them in ignorance, that they may not lift up their heads, but be brought down according to thy words.

children.name: there
children.sourceText: Behold, ye cannot know of things which ye do not see; therefore ye cannot know that there shall be a Christ.

children.name: therefore
children.sourceText: Behold, ye cannot know of things which ye do not see; therefore ye cannot know that there shall be a Christ.

children.name: these
children.sourceText: Behold, these things which ye call prophecies, which ye say are handed down by holy prophets, behold, they are foolish traditions of your fathers.

children.name: they
children.sourceText: Behold, these things which ye call prophecies, which ye say are handed down by holy prophets, behold, they are foolish traditions of your fathers.

children.name: this
children.sourceText: But behold, it is the effect of a frenzied mind; and this derangement of your minds comes because of the traditions of your fathers, which lead you away into a belief of things which are not so.

children.name: those
children.sourceText: Ye say that those ancient prophecies are true.

children.name: thou
children.sourceText: If thou wilt show me a sign, that I may be convinced that there is a God, yea, show unto me that he hath power, and then will I be convinced of the truth of thy words.

children.name: thus
children.sourceText: And ye say also that he shall be slain for the sins of the world, And thus ye lead away this people after the foolish traditions of your fathers, and according to your own desires; and ye keep them down, even as it were in bondage, that ye may glut yourselves with the labors of their hands, that they durst not look up with boldness, and that they durst not enjoy their rights and privileges.

children.name: to
children.sourceText: For no man can know of anything which is to come.
